translations.en: THE MOST GRACIOUS
has imparted this Qur’an [unto man].
He has created man:
He has imparted unto him articulate thought and speech.
[At His behest] the sun and the moon run their appointed courses;
[before Him] prostrate them­selves the stars and the trees.
And the skies has He raised high, and has devised [for all things] a measure,
so that you [too, O men,] might never transgress the measure [of what is right]:

arabicText: وَأَقِیمُوا۟ ٱلۡوَزۡنَ بِٱلۡقِسۡطِ وَلَا تُخۡسِرُوا۟ ٱلۡمِیزَانَ

translations.en: weigh, therefore, [your deeds] with equity, and cut not the measure short!
translations.ar: وَأَقِیمُوا۟ ٱلۡوَزۡنَ بِٱلۡقِسۡطِ وَلَا تُخۡسِرُوا۟ ٱلۡمِیزَانَ

translations.en: And the earth has He spread out for all living beings,
with fruit thereon, and palm trees with sheathed clusters [of dates],
and grain growing tall on its stalks, and sweet-smelling plants.
Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow?
He has created man out of sounding clay, like pottery,

arabicText: وَخَلَقَ ٱلۡجَاۤنَّ مِن مَّارِجࣲ مِّن نَّارࣲ

translations.en: whereas the invisible beings He has created out of a confusing flame of fire.
translations.ar: وَخَلَقَ ٱلۡجَاۤنَّ مِن مَّارِجࣲ مِّن نَّارࣲ

translations.en: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow?
[He is] the Sustainer of the two farthest points of sunrise, and the Sustainer of the two farthest points of sunset.
Which, then, of your Sustain­er’s powers can you disavow?
He has given freedom to the two great bodies of water, so that they might meet:
[yet] between them is a barrier which they may not transgress.
Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow?
Out of these two [bodies of water] come forth pearls, both great and small.
Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow?

arabicText: وَلَهُ ٱلۡجَوَارِ ٱلۡمُنشَـَٔاتُ فِی ٱلۡبَحۡرِ كَٱلۡأَعۡلَـٰمِ

translations.en: And His are the lofty ships that sail like [floating] mountains through the seas.
translations.ar: وَلَهُ ٱلۡجَوَارِ ٱلۡمُنشَـَٔاتُ فِی ٱلۡبَحۡرِ كَٱلۡأَعۡلَـٰمِ

translations.en: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow?
All that lives on earth or in the heavens is bound to pass away:

arabicText: وَیَبۡقَىٰ وَجۡهُ رَبِّكَ ذُو ٱلۡجَلَـٰلِ وَٱلۡإِكۡرَامِ

translations.en: but forever will abide thy Sustainer’s Self, full of majesty and glory.
translations.ar: وَیَبۡقَىٰ وَجۡهُ رَبِّكَ ذُو ٱلۡجَلَـٰلِ وَٱلۡإِكۡرَامِ

translations.en: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow?

arabicText: یَسۡـَٔلُهُۥ مَن فِی ٱلسَّمَـٰوَ ٰ⁠تِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ كُلَّ یَوۡمٍ هُوَ فِی شَأۡنࣲ

translations.en: On Him depends all creatures in the heavens and on earth; [and] every day He manifests Himself in yet another [wondrous] way.
translations.ar: یَسۡـَٔلُهُۥ مَن فِی ٱلسَّمَـٰوَ ٰ⁠تِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ كُلَّ یَوۡمٍ هُوَ فِی شَأۡنࣲ

translations.en: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow?
[ONE DAY] We shall take you to task, O you sin-laden two!
Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow?

arabicText: یَـٰمَعۡشَرَ ٱلۡجِنِّ وَٱلۡإِنسِ إِنِ ٱسۡتَطَعۡتُمۡ أَن تَنفُذُوا۟ مِنۡ أَقۡطَارِ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَ ٰ⁠تِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ فَٱنفُذُوا۟ۚ لَا تَنفُذُونَ إِلَّا بِسُلۡطَـٰنࣲ

translations.en: O you who live in close communion with [evil] invisible beings and humans! If you [think that you] can pass beyond the regions of the heavens and the earth, pass beyond them! [But] you cannot pass beyond them, save by a sanction [from God]!
translations.ar: یَـٰمَعۡشَرَ ٱلۡجِنِّ وَٱلۡإِنسِ إِنِ ٱسۡتَطَعۡتُمۡ أَن تَنفُذُوا۟ مِنۡ أَقۡطَارِ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَ ٰ⁠تِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ فَٱنفُذُوا۟ۚ لَا تَنفُذُونَ إِلَّا بِسُلۡطَـٰنࣲ

translations.en: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow?

arabicText: یُرۡسَلُ عَلَیۡكُمَا شُوَاظࣱ مِّن نَّارࣲ وَنُحَاسࣱ فَلَا تَنتَصِرَانِ

translations.en: A flash of fire will be let loose upon you, and smoke, and you will be left without succour!
translations.ar: یُرۡسَلُ عَلَیۡكُمَا شُوَاظࣱ مِّن نَّارࣲ وَنُحَاسࣱ فَلَا تَنتَصِرَانِ

translations.en: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow?

arabicText: فَإِذَا ٱنشَقَّتِ ٱلسَّمَاۤءُ فَكَانَتۡ وَرۡدَةࣰ كَٱلدِّهَانِ

translations.en: And when the sky is rent asunder and becomes red like [burning] oil
translations.ar: فَإِذَا ٱنشَقَّتِ ٱلسَّمَاۤءُ فَكَانَتۡ وَرۡدَةࣰ كَٱلدِّهَانِ

translations.en: which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow?

arabicText: فَیَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لَّا یُسۡـَٔلُ عَن ذَنۢبِهِۦۤ إِنسࣱ وَلَا جَاۤنࣱّ

translations.en: For on that Day neither man nor invisible being will be asked about his sins.
translations.ar: فَیَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ لَّا یُسۡـَٔلُ عَن ذَنۢبِهِۦۤ إِنسࣱ وَلَا جَاۤنࣱّ

translations.en: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow?

arabicText: یُعۡرَفُ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُونَ بِسِیمَـٰهُمۡ فَیُؤۡخَذُ بِٱلنَّوَ ٰ⁠صِی وَٱلۡأَقۡدَامِ

translations.en: All who were lost in sin shall by their marks be known, and shall by their forelocks and their feet be seized!
translations.ar: یُعۡرَفُ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُونَ بِسِیمَـٰهُمۡ فَیُؤۡخَذُ بِٱلنَّوَ ٰ⁠صِی وَٱلۡأَقۡدَامِ

translations.en: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow?

arabicText: هَـٰذِهِۦ جَهَنَّمُ ٱلَّتِی یُكَذِّبُ بِهَا ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُونَ

translations.en: This will be the hell which those who are lost in sin [now] call a lie:
translations.ar: هَـٰذِهِۦ جَهَنَّمُ ٱلَّتِی یُكَذِّبُ بِهَا ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُونَ

translations.en: between it and [their own] burning-hot despair will they wander to and fro!
Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow?
BUT FOR THOSE who of their Sustainer’s Presence stand in fear, two gardens [of paradise are readied] -
which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow? –
[two gardens] of many wondrous hues.
Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow?
In [each of] these two [gardens] two springs will flow.
Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow?
In [each of] these two will two kinds of every fruit be [found].
Which, then, of your Sustainer s powers can you disavow?

arabicText: مُتَّكِـِٔینَ عَلَىٰ فُرُشِۭ بَطَاۤىِٕنُهَا مِنۡ إِسۡتَبۡرَقࣲۚ وَجَنَى ٱلۡجَنَّتَیۡنِ دَانࣲ

translations.en: [In such a paradise the blest will dwell,] reclin­ing upon carpets lined with rich brocade; and the fruit of both these gardens will be within easy reach.
translations.ar: مُتَّكِـِٔینَ عَلَىٰ فُرُشِۭ بَطَاۤىِٕنُهَا مِنۡ إِسۡتَبۡرَقࣲۚ وَجَنَى ٱلۡجَنَّتَیۡنِ دَانࣲ

translations.en: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow?

arabicText: فِیهِنَّ قَـٰصِرَ ٰ⁠تُ ٱلطَّرۡفِ لَمۡ یَطۡمِثۡهُنَّ إِنسࣱ قَبۡلَهُمۡ وَلَا جَاۤنࣱّ

translations.en: In these [gardens] will be mates of modest gaze, whom neither man nor invisible being will have touched ere then.
translations.ar: فِیهِنَّ قَـٰصِرَ ٰ⁠تُ ٱلطَّرۡفِ لَمۡ یَطۡمِثۡهُنَّ إِنسࣱ قَبۡلَهُمۡ وَلَا جَاۤنࣱّ

translations.en: Which, then, of your Sus­tainer’s powers can you disavow?
[When you are promised splendours] as though [of] rubies and [of] pearls –
which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow?
Could the reward of good be aught but good?
Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow?
And besides those two will be yet two [other] gardens -
which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow? –
two [gardens] of the deepest green.
Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow?
In [each of] these two [gardens] will two springs gush forth.
Which, then, of your Sus­tainer’s powers can you disavow?
In both of them will be [all kinds of] fruit, and date-palms and pomegranates.
Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow?
In these [gardens] will be [all] things most excellent and beautiful.
Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow?
[There the blest will live with their] companions pure and modest, in pavilions [splendid] -
which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow? –

arabicText: لَمۡ یَطۡمِثۡهُنَّ إِنسࣱ قَبۡلَهُمۡ وَلَا جَاۤنࣱّ

translations.en: [companions] whom neither man nor invisible being will have touched ere then.
translations.ar: لَمۡ یَطۡمِثۡهُنَّ إِنسࣱ قَبۡلَهُمۡ وَلَا جَاۤنࣱّ

translations.en: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow?

arabicText: مُتَّكِـِٔینَ عَلَىٰ رَفۡرَفٍ خُضۡرࣲ وَعَبۡقَرِیٍّ حِسَانࣲ

translations.en: [In such a paradise will they dwell,] reclining upon meadows green and carpets rich in beauty.
translations.ar: مُتَّكِـِٔینَ عَلَىٰ رَفۡرَفٍ خُضۡرࣲ وَعَبۡقَرِیٍّ حِسَانࣲ

translations.en: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow?

arabicText: تَبَـٰرَكَ ٱسۡمُ رَبِّكَ ذِی ٱلۡجَلَـٰلِ وَٱلۡإِكۡرَامِ

translations.en: HALLOWED be thy Sustainer’s name, full of majesty and glory!
translations.ar: تَبَـٰرَكَ ٱسۡمُ رَبِّكَ ذِی ٱلۡجَلَـٰلِ وَٱلۡإِكۡرَامِ
